Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SpCrus2 (S. paramamosain crustin 2; type 2, antimicrobial protein; modular design; natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; 6S=S; UCSS1a; BBL)

Literature.Author: Wang H, Zhang JX, Wang Y, Fang WH, Wang Y, Zhou JF, Zhao S, Li XC.2018
Literature.Title: Newly identified type II crustin (SpCrus2) in Scylla paramamosain contains a distinct cysteine distribution pattern exhibiting broad antimicrobial activity

Sequence Information.Comments: Host expression: highly expressed in gill and was up-regulated with bacterial challenges.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (24.3%) toCtenidin-2.Activity: Active against Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), B. subtilis (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), B. megaterium (MIC 0.35-0.7 uM), Gram-  V. alginolyticus (MIC 1.4-2.8 uM), V. parahaemolyticus (MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), V. harveyi (MIC MIC 0.7-1.4 uM), E. coli (MIC 2.8-5.6 uM), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 2.8-5.6 uM).   In addition, SpCrus2 agglutinates gram-positive bacteria (bacteria-agglutinating).SAR: 1-64 is a GRR (gly-rich region) and 65-147 is a CRR (Cys-rich region). Both regions are antimicrobial but slightly less active than the full length.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: all the peptides were expressed and purified.7/2021; 11/2024
